head.title: Convertible Debt Offerings Set for This Week

hedline.hl1: Convertible Debt Offerings Set for This Week

block.p: The following equity and convertible debt offerings are expected this week:
3TEC Energy Corp., Houston, 6.3 million shares. Bear, Stearns & Co.
7-Eleven Inc., Dallas, 10 million shares. Salomon Smith Barney.
Accord Networks Ltd., Petach-Tikva, Israel, an initial public offering of 5 million shares. CIBC Wood Gundy.
The following equity and convertible debt offerings are expected this week:
3TEC Energy Corp., Houston, 6.3 million shares. Bear, Stearns & Co.
7-Eleven Inc., Dallas, 10 million shares. Salomon Smith Barney.
Accord Networks Ltd., Petach-Tikva, Israel, an initial public offering of 5 million shares. CIBC Wood Gundy.
ASCO P.L.C., Aberdeen, Scotland, an initial public offering of 12.5 million American depositary shares, each share represents 5 ordinary shares. Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette.
Basic Energy Services Inc., Midland, Tex., an initial public offering of 4.9 million shares. Prudential Securities.
CareScience Inc., Philadelphia, an initial public offering of 4 million shares. Deutsche Bank Alex. Brown.
Click Commerce Inc., Chicago, an initial public offering of 5 million shares. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.

Dialog Semiconductor P.L.C., Teck-Nabern, Germany, an initial public offering of 8.5 million American depositary shares, each share represents one ordinary share. Deutsche Bank Alex. Brown and Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Divine InterVentures Inc., Lisle, Ill., an initial public offering of 14.3 million class A shares. Robertson Stevens.
eFunds Corp., Milwaukee, an initial public offering of 6.3 million shares. Lehman Brothers.
Exfo Electro-Optical Engineering Inc., Quebec, Canada, an initial public offering of 6 million suborindated voting shares. Merrill Lynch & Co.
FutureLink Corp., 6 million shares. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Genuity Inc., Burlington, Mass., an initial public offering of 173.9 million class A shares. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter and Salomon Smith Barney.
Marvell Technology Group Ltd., Hamilton, Bermuda, an initial public offering of 6 million shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Mobile Telesystems O.J.S.C., Moscow, an initial public offering of 15 million of American depositary shares, each share represents 20 shares. Deutsche Bank Alex. Brown and ING Barrings.
Mobility Electronics Inc., Scottsdale, Ariz., an initial public offering of 4 million shares. Deutsche Bank Alex. Brown.
Netease.com Inc., Beijing, an initial public offering of 4.5 million American depositary shares, each share represents 60 ordinary shares. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Precise Software Solutions Ltd., Savyon, Israel, an initial public offering of 4.3 million ordinary shares. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Prudential P.L.C., London, an initial public offering of 15 million American depositary shares, each share represents 2 ordinary shares. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Santa Fe International Corp., Dallas, 30 million ordinary shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
StorageNtwks Inc., Waltham, Mass., an initial public offering of 9 million shares. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Stratos Lightwave Inc., Chicago, an initial public offering of 8.8 million shares. Lehman Brothers.
Syntroleum Corp., Tulsa, Okla., 5.3 million shares. Merrill Lynch & Co.
TrueVision International Inc., Albuquerque, N.M., 750,000 units and each unit consists of one common share and one warrant. Kashner Davidson Securities Corp.
(Source: MCM EquityWatch.)
